p: While the psychological distress during and following COVID-19 is an enormous threat to mental well-being in communities across the globe, the human central nervous system may also be directly affected by the immunologic response of the virus itself [ 29]. While neuropsychiatric sequelae may only be experienced by a fraction of cases, given the global burden of COVID-19 infection the implications of any delayed complication will be significant. With neuropsychiatric symptoms as a result of viral infection in the past being noted, they have largely been unexplored. Troyer et, al. suggest that the psychoneuroimmunology perspective following the COVID-19 pandemic will be an important aspect in the developing effects of the current pandemic [ 29].
